ceasn:description.en-us: The Construction Health and Safety Technician (CHST) certification is designed for individuals who demonstrate competency and work part-time or full-time in health and safety activities devoted to the prevention of construction illnesses and injuries.

ceasn:competencyText.en-us: Program Management - 52%
Worksite Auditing - 19%
Training - 21%
Professional Responsibility - 8%
Reading construction drawings
Health and safety hazards associated with construction activities or processes

Participate in the development of a site-specific safety plan by detailing work activities, hazards, and corrective actions in order to ensure that foreseeable hazards are addressed and expectations for compliance are communicated.
Assist in the development and review of the processes (e.g., job safety analysis) that mitigate the risks and hazards identified in site-specific safety plan.
Provide technical guidance to jobsite personnel by maintaining comprehensive knowledge of current standards, codes, best practices, interpretation, and applicability for construction activities.
Identify and coordinate with management and jobsite personnel on unanticipated hazards as they develop in order to maintain a safe and healthful work environment.
Provide technical guidance when emergency response plan has been activated to protect jobsite personnel and to mitigate loss.
Participate in incident investigations using established procedures in order to recommend appropriate corrective actions.
Perform worksite assessments to identify hazards and non-compliance in the work environment
Recommend corrective actions for the existing and potential hazards identified in the worksite assessment.
Determine training needs based on job safety analyses, regulatory requirements, trends, and/or observations made during worksite audits
Develop and deliver training that addresses legal and performance requirements, site specific hazards, trends, and observations.
Facilitate jobsite safety meetings with all trades by discussing and demonstrating safe practices to inform jobsite personnel of potential risks.
Maintain accurate records in all aspects of the safety program in accordance with established protocol to document changes, losses, and audit findings.
Maintain and expand competence in the safety profession in order to maintain certification.
Researching and determining applicable regulations
Meeting defined training objectives
Communication strategies
